revised_title: Sustained Feedback Effects of L-horizontal Cells on Turtle Cones
tldr: The article explores the sustained feedback effects of L-horizontal cells on turtle cones. Prolonged peripheral light stimulation induces diverse sustained feedback effects, including complex long depolarizations, prolonged increases in electrical excitability, and sustained oscillations. These effects are blocked by cone hyperpolarization and Ca2+ channel-blocking agents and are associated with an increase in membrane Ca2+ conductance. The study demonstrates that the feedback effects of L-horizontal cells on cones are not only transient but also sustained.
